rooms.name: Hilltop

items.name: letter
items.usage: The letter is from your long-lost love, Yennefer of Vengerberg, imploring you to meet her in Willoughby, a town near White Orchard that has since been burned to the ground.

items.name: steelSword
items.usage: The witcher's steel sword is used to fight humans or other non-magical enemies.

items.name: silverSword
items.usage: The witcher's silver sword is used to fight monsters.

rooms.script: You stand on a hilltop, from which you can see the nearby town of White Orchard, the ruins of an ancient castle, and a small group of houses that have been destroyed by some passing army.

rooms.name: Village Outskirts
rooms.script: You are on a stretch of road heading in the direction of White Orchard. Just in front of you, there seems to be some sort of commotion...

obstacle.description: There's a huge winged beast tearing into a horse carcass on the road in front of you. It doesn't look very friendly...
obstacle.clear message: You've slain the griffin and can now move freely through this area.

rooms.name: White Orchard
rooms.script: You stand in the small, medieval village of White Orchard. You can see a forge, a house with hides tanning outside, and a tavern which seems well-frequented by the villagers.

rooms.name: Village Blacksmith
rooms.script: You see a dwarf hard at work, banging out something on an anvil. Maybe he could forge something for you.

obstacle.item dropped usage: The advanced silver sword will let you fight more powerful monsters than your regular silver sword.
obstacle.description: You need a diagram to forge a new sword.
obstacle.clear message: The blacksmith has forged you a new silver sword.

rooms.name: Hunter's House
rooms.script: As you reach the house with the hides tanning outside, its inhabitant - a hunter - tells you he's seen the griffin flying around nearby above the forest.

rooms.name: Dense Woods
rooms.script: The daylight filters down through many branches overhead. This seems to be an insignificant patch of forest.

rooms.name: Forest Clearing
rooms.script: A pleasant clearing in the thicket, but otherwise not noteworthy.

rooms.name: Cliff Base
rooms.script: You arrive at an open area with many boulders strewn about. As a witcher, you know that griffins like to make their nests atop cliffs, much like the one nearby.

obstacle.description: You'll want to make sure the griffin is in its nest before you climb the cliff. The open air in this area might allow a strong smell to travel far...
obstacle.clear message: The ghoul blood spread over the rocks is sure to attract the griffin's attention - it's likely in its nest now.

rooms.name: Clifftop
rooms.script: You climb the cliff and see a collection of branches littered with remains both human and animal. This is definitely the griffin's nest.

obstacle.item dropped usage: This head is proof that you've slain the griffin as requested by the Nilfgaardians.
obstacle.description: Curiosity piqued by the ghoul's blood, the griffin eyes you and emits a screeching roar.
obstacle.clear message: After a hard-fought battle, you manage to slay the griffin. Better take a trophy to prove you've done what the garrison asked...

rooms.name: Tavern
rooms.script: The tavern is dark and smells of smoke and spilled ale. A bartender behind the counter polishes a mug, while a group of peasants eye you suspiciously. This might be a good place to ask if Yennefer has passed through White Orchard.

obstacle.item dropped usage: This might brighten the mood of your average village peasant.
obstacle.description: The bartender looks at you pointedly over the counter.
obstacle.clear message: You've bought a nice cold ale from the bartender.

rooms.name: Back Room
rooms.script: You step into the back room of the tavern, occupied by more peasants nursing mugs.

obstacle.description: When you try to ask the villagers here about Yennefer, they just tell you to piss off.
obstacle.clear message: Their moods brightening significantly with the offered ale, the peasants tell you that Yennefer was last seen at the Nilfgaardian garrison near White Orchard.

rooms.name: Abandoned Village

items.name: orens
items.usage: Apparently missed by the marauding army, this small sum could be used to buy something in the village.

rooms.script: You stand in the still-smoldering remains of a small settlement that was clearly "visited" by a passing army, likely the Nilfgaardian invaders.

rooms.name: Castle Ruins

items.name: silverDiagram
items.usage: This diagram seems to indicate how to create a more advanced witcher's silver sword.

rooms.script: You stand amidst the ruins of a small keep, the only remnant of some long-forgotten lord.

obstacle.item dropped usage: The most relevant currency to date, these would probably be accepted by even foreigners.
obstacle.description: Some menacing-looking bandits have taken up these ruins as a base.
obstacle.clear message: You've killed the bandits blocking your path and can claim the money they left, as well as visit new areas.

rooms.name: Battlefield
rooms.script: You see bodies spread out across the site of a gruesome conflict between two armies.

obstacle.item dropped usage: You feel like this pungent liquid could be smelled from a mile away.
obstacle.description: Drawn by the fresh corpses, there are a number of ghouls here picking over the area.
obstacle.clear message: You've slain the ghouls - after all, monsters sometime drop useful materials.

rooms.name: Main Road
rooms.script: This leads out of the village of White Orchard to places like Vizima, passing by the local Nilfgaardian encampment on the way.

obstacle.description: An official-looking Nilfgaardian has set up a counter at a crossroads with several guards. It appears you must pay a toll to use this road.
obstacle.clear message: You have paid the toll and may move freely on the main road from now on.

rooms.name: Nilfgaardian Garrison
rooms.script: You reach the camp of the local garrison of the invading army. They have told you that they will tell you where Yennefer has gone and help you get there if you deal with a problem for them: apparently that griffin had a mate. They warn you that this griffin seems bigger and stronger, and might require a very good weapon to defeat.

obstacle.description: Without a horse, you won't be able to get all the way to the palace in Vizima. You'll need to bring the Nilfgaardians proof that you've killed the other griffin.
obstacle.clear message: You've gotten confirmation that Yennefer was last headed for the Nilfgaardian seat in Vizima, and the garrison has given you a horse.

rooms.name: Imperial Palace
rooms.script: You have reunited with Yennefer at the seat of the Nilfgaardian invasion in the captured city of Vizima. Emperor Emyhr var Emreis demands your presence for an audience.
